quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Usa and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, nickname, wisconsin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which event happened for the first time on 3 April 1973 on Lexington Avenue in New York City?

options.text: The first commercial sale of a microwave oven was done.
The first anabolic steroid was formed.
The first cell phone call was made.
The first tablet computer was sold.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first cell phone call was made.

questions.question: Which are the colors of Purdue University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old gold and black

questions.question: What do these American movies have in common: “The Running Man”, “Predator”, and “Batman and Robin” (1997)?

options.text: They have one and the same executive producer and director.
They have one and the same writers and director.
They have two governors in their cast.
They each set box office records on their opening day.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have two governors in their cast.

questions.question: Boston University is the largest private university in the U.S.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What do the following US states have in common: Missouri, Wisconsin, Nebraska, and Mississippi.

options.text: Their largest cities are named after famous Americans.
Their capital cities are named after US Presidents.
Their state basketball teams have each won one national championship.
They have one and the same bird for state bird.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their capital cities are named after US Presidents.

questions.question: Where would you find the only royal palace to serve as an official residence in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honolulu, Hawaii

questions.question: Which of these is the biggest retail wine store in the USA?

options.text: The New Yorker Wine and Liquor Pavillion
Sams Wine and Spirits of Chicago

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sams Wine and Spirits of Chicago

questions.question: 13 is the lucky number of which school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colgate University

questions.question: Harvard University was the most highly selective college/university in the U.S. in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who won the Orteig Prize in 1927?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Lindbergh

questions.question: What do these animals have in common: badger, beaver, lynx, wolf, wolverine, coyote, fox, impala, kangaroo, rabbit, roadrunner?

options.text: They are the original animals shown when the Lincoln Park Zoo opened.
They are the original animals shown during American television show Wild Kingdoms first year on television.
They are the original animals shown when the Bronx Zoo opened.
They are all used in names of cars.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are all used in names of cars.

questions.question: The key to the notorious prison in France, the Bastille, is in the USA. Where is it kept?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in George Washingtons home

questions.question: In which US city was the childrens show Mr. Rogers Neighbourhood produced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pittsburgh

questions.question: What was South Carolinas nickname, before it was called the Palmetto State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Iodine State

questions.question: Which American building was the world’s first building to have air conditioning installed for comfort?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New York Stock Exchange

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and University
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, schools, average. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these schools is not famous for its Medicine Department?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rochester Institute of Technology

questions.question: The Atlantic Ocean has a greater average depth than the Indian Ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is true about University of Pennsylvania, Cornell University and Brown University?

options.text: They all admit about 55% of their applicants
They all have filials in both Asia and Europe
They are all in one and the same state
They are all members of the Ivy League

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are all members of the Ivy League

questions.question: This state, with a capital of Jaipur, is the largest state in India.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rajasthan

questions.question: On May 22, 1960, an earthquake with magnitude of 9.5 was recorded in which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chile

questions.question: Which one of the following countries borders Chile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argentina

questions.question: What port on the Atlantic Ocean is the largest city and capital of Sierra Leone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freetown

questions.question: The American continent  was named after which Italian merchant and cartographer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amerigo Vespuci

questions.question: On September 13, 1922 a temperature of 135.9°F (57.7°C) was recorded in Al Aziziyah, a city in which African country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Libya

questions.question: What mountain, located in the Sentinel Range of the Ellesworth Mountains, is the highest mountain in Antarctica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vinson Massif

questions.question: Which ocean is the worlds largest body of water, covering nearly one third of the Earths surface?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pacific Ocean

questions.question: Which university is prominent for its botanical garden, which is one of the biggest in the U.S.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of California, Berkeley

questions.question: Which college/university is the first to own a dinosaur egg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colgate University

questions.question: This mega-city was originally a municipality, founded in 1521 by Fernán Cortés.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mexico City

questions.question: This sea, which is a basin of the Indian Ocean between Africa and Asia, is the worlds most northern tropical sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Sea

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Countries
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nepal, borobudur. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If I wanted to visit The Shwedagon Pagoda, would I go to France?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Angkor Wat is in Cambodia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following countries borders Djibouti?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ethiopia

questions.question: Pharaoh Khufu was burried in the Great Pyramid of Giza.  Where can we find that pyramid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: The Statue of Liberty, is one of the most widely known statues in history. What country is it in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USA

questions.question: Which one of the following countries borders Uruguay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil

questions.question: Is there a country that borders Haiti?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Nepal is bordered by which of these countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Is there a country that borders Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The Falkland Islands are in the South Pacific Ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Borobudur Temple is in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indonesia

questions.question: Which of these countries borders Belize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guatemala

questions.question: This palace was built for love.  It is what what every women wants her husband to do for her. The Taj Mahal is located in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Which one of these countries shares a border with  Turkmenistan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iran

questions.question: New Zealand and Australia share a border.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: New Jersey and Capital
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Just one of these states has a minimum driving age of exactly sixteen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: Parking is not allowed in one of these cases.

options.text: Parking is not allowed in any of these cases.
Within 20 feet (6 m) of a crosswalk at an intersection.
Along a curb that has been cut down, lowered or constructed for access to the sidewalk.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parking is not allowed in any of these cases.

questions.question: On a New York State highway where there is no posted speed limit, the fastest speed at which you may legally drive is this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 55 mph

questions.question: This U.S. president, who served non-consecutive terms,  was born in New Jersey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland

questions.question: If your car starts to skid on a slippery road, you should do this.

options.text: Lock your brakes until you come to a full stop.
Steer toward the side of the road to get off the wet pavement.
Brake quickly and keep the wheel straight.
Steer in the direction you want the front wheels to go.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steer in the direction you want the front wheels to go.

questions.question: What is the capital of New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trenton

questions.question: The White House is the home of the US head of government.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On long trips you can prevent drowsiness by performing this.

options.text: Stopping at regular intervals for a rest.
Moving your eyes from side to side as you drive.
Slowing down so you can react better.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stopping at regular intervals for a rest.

questions.question: This is the only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC).

options.text: Allow your body time to get rid of alcohol.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Allow your body time to get rid of alcohol.

questions.question: This Nobel peace prize winner went from Governor of New Jersey to the President of the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodrow Wilson

questions.question: Which of these was not born in New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ally Sheedy

questions.question: When a school bus is stopped and its red lights are flashing (or stop signs are extended), it means this.

options.text: You may pass if no children are on the road.
You may pass if you are facing the front of the bus.
You may pass if it is on the other side of a divided highway.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You may not pass.

questions.question: This famous singer from Hoboken became Chairman of the Board .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Sinatra

questions.question: Which of these people was not born in New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck  Yeager

questions.question: A bicyclist differs from a motorist in that he is not required to do this.

options.text: Report accidents resulting in serious injury.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Insure the bicycle.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: New Jersey and North America
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Arkansas is west of Oklahoma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: California is the largest state in North America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which one of these singers was not born in New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice Cooper

questions.question: Which state has the smallest area in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: New Jersey was settled first by this nation in the early 1630s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Netherlands

questions.question: Which ocean does New York City border?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlantic

questions.question: What is the capital of Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Austin

questions.question: The Great Lakes are located in South America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On what continent is Mexico?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North America

questions.question: Africa is located east of North America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these firsts did not originate in New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First US iron mine

questions.question: Name the mountain chain that runs through British Columbia all the way down to New Mexico.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Mountains

questions.question: How many continents are there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Which one of the following was not invented in New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sewing Machine

questions.question: Which of the following is not a real ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these rivers is not located in Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Segura

questions.question: The city of Paris is built on an arc of this river.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seine

questions.question: This Tibetan lake is located at the highest altitude.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lhagba Pool

questions.question: Prior to 1989, this county was bordered by three countries that do not exist anymore.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: The name of which country means Rich Harbour?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puerto Rico

questions.question: The name of the deepest lake in the world, Lake Baikal, derives from Tatar Bai-Kul, meaning this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rich Lake

questions.question: Arrange the following oceans by their total area, starting with the largest:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2, 1, 3, 5, 4

questions.question: Which country used to rule vast areas from South America through Africa to East Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portugal

questions.question: The Suez canal connects the Red Sea with this sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mediterranean Sea

questions.question: Which country is divided by a canal connecting the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Panama

questions.question: The Bermuda Triangle is located in this ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Atlantic Ocean

questions.question: The Adriatic Sea separates these two peninsulas.

options.text: The Scandinavian Peninsula from the Balkan Peninsula
The Iberian Peninsula from the Apennine Peninsula
The Balkan Peninsula from the Iberian Peninsula
The Apennine Peninsula from the Balkan Peninsula

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Apennine Peninsula from the Balkan Peninsula

questions.question: The Bay of Pigs is located on the coast of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba

questions.question: On what continent is the highest mountain in the world located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asia

questions.question: The Great Lakes are a group of five large lakes on or near the United States-Canadian border.  This is the largest of the Great Lakes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Superior
